text: DEFINITION
A cultural aesthetic mixing science fiction, art expression and African cultural behaves
Reinvent the past, looking forward to the future
New reality perspective transcending racism, excluding, lonely and violence,
Keep a connection with the past and the identity of our ancestors
Afrofuturism has strong connections with Pan-Africanism
"Space is the place" - Sun Ra
ABOUT THE TERM
Some of the definitions appeared in the article "Black Science Fiction" in The Wire magazine in 1992.
Defined when Mark Dery wrote the essay "Black to the Future" in the book Flame Wars in 1994
It exposes common features between sci-fi, music and african and diaspora culture.
data.desc: Explain how the term was created

text: THE TRIAD OF ORIGINATORS OF AFROFUTURISM
Sun Ra
Jazz Player, Experimental Music, Poet, Composer
Manifest a unified concept incorporating music, myth and performance
Octavia Butler
Black Woman Writer
She wrote sci-fi books interacting with racism, time travelling and women's empowerment
Earned multiples prizes related with sci-fi writing
George Clinton + Parliament-Funkadelic - Musician
Mothership Connection, space and time travelling looking for advancement, enlightenment and fun
data.desc: Expose the originators of the afrofuturism

text: OTHER PIONEERS OF AFROFUTURISM
> Basquiat
Painter who used art as form of protest, brings graffiti to galleries and explores street art
> Grace Jones - Super Model, Singer, Performer
One of first black super model in the industry
> Samuel Delany - Writer
Books: Babel 17, Dhalgren
"I figured another place you wouldn't think black people would be was in outer space.
I was a big fan of Star Trek, so we did a thing with a pimp sitting in a spaceship shaped like a Cadillac,
and we did all these James Brown - type grooves, but with street talk and ghetto slang" - George Cliton

EGYPT AND NUBIANS SHOW WHY FUTURE IS ALWAYS PRESENT IN THE AFRICAN CULTURE
> Advanced societies into Africa thousand of years ago
> Science, mythology and religion, combined with astronomy, architecture and writing
> Expansive and Inclusive society, before the Western World's culture (Greek)
Africa always have showed in many expression, exact and human sciences together
data.desc: Egypt show why future is always present in african culture

text: BLACK PEOPLE AT TECHNOLOGY REVOLUTIONIZING THE INDUSTRY

text: WHAT IS GOING ON BRAZIL ABOUT AFROFUTURISM
From 70s until now there are many artists creating content with afrofuturism concepts
> Jorge Ben in the 70s
Egypt Alchemy Theories + Blackness + Love + Space
> Chico Science & Nação Zumbi in the 90s
Brazil Northeast Regional Music + African Rhythms, Hip hop, Electronic, Crabs and Blackness
> Marcelo D Salete - Comic Book Writer
Acclaimed for works describing Afro-Brazilian slaveries resistance: Cumbe (Run For It) and Angola Janga
> Fabio Kabral - Writer
O Caçador Cibernetico da Rua 13” (13th streeet’s cybernetic hunter) - Ioruba mythology + Sci-Fi
> Augusto Oliveira
Hip Hop and time travelling inside the Back To Future's DeLorean
> Ellen Oleria - Singer who winner of the First The Voice Brazil
Brazilian Music with Afrofuturistic elements
